definition: to grow and multiply without end
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
(negative prefix)/not/no
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Each of us is a star shines in the sky of Sina.
sentences.chinese: 每个你我，都是一颗星星，在新浪的天空里生生不息。

sentences.english: But could youth last, and love still breed.
sentences.chinese: 但若青春能永驻，爱生生不息。

sentences.english: Nature's way of tricking people into reproducing.
sentences.chinese: 大自然为了使人类生生不息而设的圈套。

sentences.english: From ancient to present, grows continually, millennium fusion.
sentences.chinese: 从古到今，生生不息，千年的融合。

sentences.english: The source seems visional , far, senseless and smell-less, but it is inexhaustible power to supply all things.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它却源源不绝地供应大地生生不息的动力。

sentences.english: Keep that spirit alive when   you return home. These were truly exceptional Games!
sentences.chinese: 希望你们回国后让这种精神生生不息，时代永存。

sentences.english: Yuan is unfolded as virtues and ceaseless producing.
sentences.chinese: 元展开为德性与生生不息。

definition: continually/without a break/ceaselessly
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
continuous/endless
lit. the cycle comes back to the start (idiom); to move in circles/the wheel comes full circle
heaven and earth/world/scope/field of activity
all living things
vitality
fountainhead/well-spring/water source/fig. origin
opportunity to live/to reprieve from death/life force/vitality
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
from generation to generation/generation after generation
see 薪火相傳|薪火相传[xin1 huo3 xiang1 chuan2]
to nourish
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to evolve (of ideas, designs, constructions etc)/to develop and change
all things tend in one direction (idiom)
